job_description: I am the leader of the local chapter of the Maquis, the last human resistance against the Xenoid invaders.

no: How can I help you citizen?

yes: I am so glad to see anyone still wearing a U.S. Marshal Badge.  I'm going to assume that you didn't pick it up off a dead zombie but it doesn't really matter since this Armageddon is the great equalizer.  What can we do for each other today?
no: I don't recognize you, but I will next time.  My name is Mr. Erikson and I'm in overall ground command around here, by attrition if nothing else.  If you've come all the way up here you must have a reason.  What can we do for each other today?

dynamic_line: We do have plans to expand facilities here at Barter Tower, but the Maquis have been fighting for survival for weeks now.  If you want to take point on the task, I will leave base expansion entirely in our control.  Talk to the quartermaster on the ground level, he should still be wearing his postman uniform.

I'm glad that throughout all this craziness with the world ending that young man ended up exactly where he is needed.  Randy always took stuff apart as a kid and usually put it back together, so I'm sure he'll make a great technician for the refugee center.

dynamic_line: You want one?  I have several hundred of them in a cardboard box around here somewhere.  I don't have any batteries, but it shouldn't be too hard to find an ultra-light battery downstairs from one of the merchants.

dynamic_line: Its a funny story about a Mexican cartel drug front, a CIA Honeypot, an FBI Reco case, and the Library of Congress's newspaper archives.  The Cartel was trying to launder their drug and human trafficking money by building a large indoor go-cart race track.  Somehow the CIA had an agent within the that specific cartel and were able to influence the cartel to invest far more money than they should have, after which the FBI collected all the bad guys they had this building practically ready to open.  The FBI ended up giving most of the floors to the Library of Congress to store newspapers, and some of the other usual suspects took their share too.  Once this cataclysm happened and much of the government was destroyed, this site was commandeered to coordinate local responses against the Xenoids.

responses.text: I have some questions about the Xenoids.

dynamic_line: We don't exactly know what they are or how exactly they relate to the rest this cataclysm that has been happening.  From their tactics we can assume that the Xenoids are operating as a sort of paramilitary or an expeditionary force. They seem to favor melee weapons and shield rather than long range firearms, however they also are able to fire short range flechette darts.  As if that was bad enough these aliens have some mind-affecting abilities that I cannot explain at all.  Having said all that they are not immortal, we can make them bleed so we can make them die.

responses.text: [INT 11] Wait, back that up.  What do you mean 'mind-affecting'?

dynamic_line: I haven't experienced it myself, but there have been numerous credible reports of the Xenoids waving their hands around and causing severe nausea, hallucinations, even panic attacks to someone nearby.
It wasn't bad enough that we are fighting against an extra-terrestrial invasion force, but of course they have to have some kind of evil Jedi mind powers.

dynamic_line: They appeared suddenly as soon as the cataclysm began, several high value military bases in the west US, along with the largest population centers were effectively disintegrated by space based weapon systems, and virtually every man-made satellite blinked off at the same instant.  Our military response has been crippled as there is some unknown effect which prevents aircraft from operating higher than a few hundred feet.

Based on our latest reports, the Xenoids are an extra-terrestrial invasion which has used weapons of mass destruction on human civillians, and seems bent on the conquest of Earth.  Its like the plot of a 1950's pulp science fiction book or a poorly conceived, open-source, rouge-like game.

There have been rumors of other types haven't been encountered yet.

dynamic_line: We know of two types of Xenoid drones, reconnaissance and seeker drones.  Seeker drones do just that, seek out enemies and engage them.  Reconnaissance drones won't engage in combat unless cornered and if they are engaged they flee as quickly as possible.  Both types of drones are capable of emitting a bright light and temporarily blinding you, but seeker drones can also taze you.

description: Mr. Erikson needs fire-power that the United States Military used to have.  Find a map of military operations so that you can know where the heavy guns can be found.

dialogue.describe: I need you to go into find me an operations map.  It doesn't matter if you look at it first, I just need some kind of intel for the local area.
dialogue.offer: The next time you go out salvaging I need you to find me an operations map for whatever military was in this area, things got crazy when the aliens first arrived and any new information would help.
dialogue.advice: There is definitely one at the nearest military base, but its probably in the hidden underground center, but then again you could find an operation map on any random zombie soldier.
dialogue.success: Thanks!  Now to see what is around here.

name.str: Bring enforcements to an operative setting up a forward base.

description: Go to the entrance to the secret lab and meet up with the operative there.  Bring two volunteers reinforcements, and get them all there alive.

dialogue.offer: With the intel you got us, the Maquis recently found an access shaft hidden in a forest, which leads right down into a secret laboratory.  I need you to find two volunteers downstairs, tell them that Mr. Erikson needs them for a mission, and take them to this location, and meet up with an operative already there, she knows you're coming.  Try very hard to not get anyone killed out there, yourself included.
dialogue.accepted: That's great, go choose your four squad-members and get going.
dialogue.advice: You can recruit anyone that is off-duty on balcony level downstairs, but if someone is guarding or has a job to do cannot be recruited for combat missions.
dialogue.inquire: Don't you have a job to do?
dialogue.success: Excellent, this will allow the Maquis to much needed resources.
